title: Puppeteer
a
https://pptr.dev/
is a node.js library that makes it easy to do advanced web scraping and spidering.

inline_content.Text: is a node.js library that makes it easy to do advanced web scraping and spidering.

title: Older generation of web scraping and spidering tools would grab and analyze HTML pages as returned by a web server.

inline_content.Text: Older generation of web scraping and spidering tools would grab and analyze HTML pages as returned by a web server.

title: It doesn't work well anymore because less and less website are static HTML pages. Today websites are often applications written in JavaScript that generate HTML on the client, not the server.

inline_content.Text: It doesn't work well anymore because less and less website are static HTML pages. Today websites are often applications written in JavaScript that generate HTML on the client, not the server.

title: To get the final HTML output your scraper needs to run that JavaScript.

inline_content.Text: To get the final HTML output your scraper needs to run that JavaScript.

title: That used to be very difficult but Puppeteer makes it easy.

inline_content.Text: That used to be very difficult but Puppeteer makes it easy.

title: Puppeteer uses Chrome to run web application and uses CDP (
Chrome DevTools Protocol
a
https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/
) to access the webpage.

inline_content.Text: Puppeteer uses Chrome to run web application and uses CDP (

c

title: Puppeteer provides
Page.setRequestInterception(true)
c
hook for intercepting HTTP requests before they happen as well as inspecting completed HTTP responses.

inline_content.Text: hook for intercepting HTTP requests before they happen as well as inspecting completed HTTP responses.

inline_content.Text: Here's a program that prints information about all HTTP requests and responses:

title: Notice that fetching a page also fetches all resources used by that page, just like in a web browser. For that reason to find out status code for the url we requested, we have to remember it in a variable in
response
c
hook.

title: requestfailed
c
hook is for errors on network connection level e.g. DNS resolution failed, there's not network at all, network connection got interrupted etc.

inline_content.Text: hook is for errors on network connection level e.g. DNS resolution failed, there's not network at all, network connection got interrupted etc.

title: Your JavaScript code is executed in two different contexts:

inline_content.Text: Your JavaScript code is executed in two different contexts:

title: main script is executed in node.js. In that context
console.log("foo")
c
prints to shell

inline_content.Text: main script is executed in node.js. In that context

title: scripts provided to
Page.evaluate
c
method are serialized to text, sent to the browser via Chrome DevTools Protocol and executed inside the browser. In that context
console.log("foo")
c
prints to browser console, which you can't see.

inline_content.Text: method are serialized to text, sent to the browser via Chrome DevTools Protocol and executed inside the browser. In that context
prints to browser console, which you can't see.

title: It's slow to test browser script executed via
Page.evaluate
c
because you have to start the browser, load the page etc.

inline_content.Text: It's slow to test browser script executed via
because you have to start the browser, load the page etc.

title: To test scripts faster I test them directly in the browser, using excellent Chrome dev tools.

inline_content.Text: To test scripts faster I test them directly in the browser, using excellent Chrome dev tools.

title: Now that you've seen a few advanced uses of Puppeteer, you should study its API a bit to learn what else is possible. CDP is very powerful:

inline_content.Text: Now that you've seen a few advanced uses of Puppeteer, you should study its API a bit to learn what else is possible. CDP is very powerful:

title: Page class
a
https://pptr.dev/#?product=Puppeteer&show=api-class-page
allows hooking many events, reading and setting cookies, simulating interaction like mouse clicks etc.

inline_content.Text: allows hooking many events, reading and setting cookies, simulating interaction like mouse clicks etc.

title: Tracing class
a
https://pptr.dev/#?product=Puppeteer&show=api-class-tracing
allows creating a trace file for future inspection in Chrome DevTools

inline_content.Text: allows creating a trace file for future inspection in Chrome DevTools

title: Coverage class
a
https://pptr.dev/#?product=Puppeteer&show=api-class-coverage
allows measuring JavaScript and CSS coverage

inline_content.Text: allows measuring JavaScript and CSS coverage
